meanings.definition: The act of preserving biological material by freezing it at very low temperatures.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use cryopreservations to keep cells safe for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The cryopreservations of the plant samples ensured their freshness for research.
meanings.sent3: The cryopreservations of the fish made sure they stayed fresh for the big aquarium.
meanings.sent4: The cryopreservations of the seeds were like time-stopping magic for the gardeners.
meanings.sent5: The cryopreservations of the blood samples were like icy shields protecting their secrets.

meanings.definition: The process of storing cells or tissues at extremely low temperatures for future use.
meanings.sent1: The cryopreservations of the organs were crucial for medical advancements.
meanings.sent2: Researchers rely on cryopreservations to preserve important biological samples.
meanings.sent3: The cryopreservations of the fruit made for a chilly surprise in the summer.
meanings.sent4: The cryopreservations of the cells were like a deep freeze for future experiments.
meanings.sent5: The cryopreservations of the tissues were like a cold time capsule waiting to be opened.
